content:
Hello -
(Version: 5.13)

We have a user who published a data set that's full of tab files (around 1000). It looks like the publishing is stuck, because it's been greater than 12 hours and the page still says "Publish in Progress".

I am looking at the access log and the server log, but not seeing anything standing out there.

Any pointers on how to debug this? Thanks!

The only relevant looking server.log message I can find around this time is:

[#|2025-01-09T00:49:07.200+0000|WARNING|Payara 5.2022.3|edu.harvard.iq.dataverse.util.BundleUtil|_ThreadID=97;_ThreadName=http-thread-pool::jk-connector(4);_TimeMillis=1736383747200;_LevelValue=900;|
Could not find key "externaltools.spreadsheetPreviewer.displayname" in bundle file: |#]

Though it is set (as displayName -- typo?) and it does work in the UI, so I think this may not be relevant.
Hmm, I would start by reading this: https://guides.dataverse.org/en/5.13/admin/troubleshooting.html#a-dataset-is-locked-and-cannot-be-edited-or-published
Oh nice - I'll read that and poke around a little. Thanks, Phil!
Sure thing. Please keep the questions coming.
